result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin J. Turley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**AMENDED TO 1 YEAR PROBATION AND EXPUNCTION HEARING IS NOW 10-28-15 @ 8:45 AM**
Credit for 2 days served if revoked.  
Expunction hearing 10-28-15 at 8:45 am.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.  
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Deft can live in Illinois

records.addlTxt: NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  No appearance by the Defendant.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Expunction hearing.  No action taken.
Discharged from probation on 9/26/15
Discharge - Regular on 9-26-15
Hearing on October 28, 2015 at 08:45 am.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Atty M Perz appeared on behalf of deft, who did not appear.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court amends judgment, orders probation extended to a total period of 1 year.  Atty Perz to notify deft of resentencing and of appeals rights.
Hearing on November 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Copy of e-mail from DOC Agt Debra Adams.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI waived.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 9 months w/conditions; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 surcharge; credit for two days served if revoked.  Expunction hearing 7/27/15 at 8:45am.
Plea hearing on September 26, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Perz is in another branch; requesting adjournment.  PLEAH adjourned to 9/26/14 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.
Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  PLEAH set for 9/2/14 at 2:30pm.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Perz acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty plea.  DA PTC 7/25/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 8/12/14 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Matthew Perz.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6 for arraignment on 7/2/14 at 8:15.  Bond continued.
